context_bundle.summary: Polling strategies with exponential backoff for checking file-based message queues and state files without blocking

onboarding.quick_start: Poll inbox/outbox with exponential backoff: Start at 100ms, double each iteration, cap at 5s max. Return after max attempts to prevent indefinite blocking.
common_patterns: Initial delay: Start with short delay (100ms) for responsiveness
Exponential backoff: Double delay each iteration (100ms→200ms→400ms→800ms)
Max delay cap: Cap at 5s to prevent excessive waiting
Max polls: Return after N polls (default 60) to avoid infinite loops
Adaptive polling: Increase frequency during high activity periods
known_errors: Short delays increase CPU usage (filesystem overhead)
Long delays increase latency (slower response time)
Busy waiting without backoff wastes CPU cycles
PhiVector DC cannot use Thread.Sleep in many contexts
